(a)	 show that the equation  f (x) = 0  has a root, α, in the interval [1, 2]

(b)	 starting with the interval [1, 2], use interval bisection twice to show that α lies in the 
interval [1.25, 1.5]
(3)

(ii)	 using 1.375 as a first approximation for α, apply the newton-raphson process 
once to f (x) to determine a second approximation for α, giving your answer to 
3 decimal places.
(3)
	
(d)	 use linear interpolation once on the interval [1.25, 1.5] to obtain a different 
approximation for α, giving your answer to 3 decimal places.
(3)
